meanings.definition: Come or go back to a place.
meanings.sent1: After playing outside, the children will return home for dinner.
meanings.sent2: I need to return the library books before they are due.
meanings.sent3: The lost dog will return to its owner after a long adventure.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts always return to the peaceful days of her childhood.
meanings.sent5: The migrating birds will return to this area every spring.

meanings.definition: Give, put, or send something back to a place or person.
meanings.sent1: Please return the borrowed tools to the neighbor when you're done.
meanings.sent2: I will return the package to the post office for a refund.
meanings.sent3: The magician asked the audience to return the vanished coin with a wave of his wand.
meanings.sent4: She decided to return the favor by helping her friend move to a new apartment.
meanings.sent5: The kind stranger returned the lost wallet to its grateful owner.

meanings.definition: A profit made on an investment.
meanings.sent1: The stock market experienced a significant return on investment this quarter.
meanings.sent2: He was pleased with the return he received from investing in the company.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected return on the lottery ticket left him speechless.
meanings.sent4: The return on the property sale exceeded their expectations.
meanings.sent5: The return on the antique vase was much higher than anticipated.

meanings.definition: An act of going or coming back.
meanings.sent1: The return journey from the beach was filled with laughter and memories.
meanings.sent2: She looked forward to the return trip to her favorite vacation spot.
meanings.sent3: The return of the prodigal son brought tears of joy to his family.
meanings.sent4: The return of the astronauts from space was celebrated worldwide.
meanings.sent5: The return of the migrating geese signaled the arrival of spring.
